newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian man pleads for return of kidnapped wife.
newsitem.headline: Australian man pleads for return of kidnapped wife.

text.p: The husband of a wealthy Australian woman kidnapped 17 days ago begged for her return and told his wife not to give up hope in a videotape released by police on Friday.
"I will do whatever (the kidnappers) ask and will go anywhere to ensure the safety of my wife," millionaire businessman Bernard Whelan said in the video.
"Kerry, if you can hear what I am saying, I want you to know we all love you, we will do anything to get you back but, most of all, do not give up," he said.
Kerry Whelan, a 39-year-old mother of three, was last seen leaving her car in an underground carpark in the western Sydney suburb of Parramatta on May 6.
She was wearing several gold and diamond rings and bracelets, including one bracelet boasting 20 diamonds.
Police and her husband said on Wednesday they held grave fears for her safety because there had been no contact with her abductors since a deadline for their unspecified ransom demands had expired.
Police, who had previously kept Whelan's kidnapping secret, said the abductors had made several ransom demands for "a substantial sum of money".
